posts.author: gralf
posts.post_text: November 27, 2018 at 6:28 PM#8And there is an additional lock if you add a line with login.Two scenarios:1. first the dmx-hardkey-remote-thing, then as last line of the macro a new line with "login"> result: the console is locked and then the login appears.If the user logs in then the desk-locked-screen comes up. This might confuse some users.2. Login on first line, then the dmx-hardkey-remote-thing.> result: the console enters the login-screen and then locks in the back.If the user logs in the console is still locked and seams to be frozen, but it's not. It's just locked. Just unlock once with pause.This just has been tested with onPC 3.5.0.2 on Win10 and on console. Very cool, but I guess it's only working on Session-Master.Gralf

posts.author: glad
posts.post_text: January 19, 2019 at 8:59 PM#13Remotes are handled by (= executed on) the session-master.You would need to set the Station-Priority to High, on the station which you would want this to happen, to make sure that it is the Master, if you have multiple stations.
